# Conditionals 
 
## Introduction

In kotlin a conditional is expressed with the `if` statement.

```kotlin
if (condition) {
    do_something()
}
```

Where `condition` can be any boolean expression.

* `1 == 1` evaluates to `true`
* `1 == 2` evaluates to `false`
* `"hello" == "hello"` evaluates to `true`


## A simple program with a conditional expression

Copy the following into a file named `Instruction05.kt`                 
 
<img alt="../media/conditionals-001.jpg" src="../media/conditionals-001.jpg" loading="lazy"> 
 
```kotlin
import org.openrndr.application
import org.openrndr.color.ColorRGBa

fun main() = application {
    configure {
        width = 720
        height = 720
    }
    program {
        var x = 0.0
        extend {
            drawer.circle(x, 360.0, 20.0)
            x = x + 1.0 // re-assign x to the current value of x plus 1.0
            
            if (x > 720.0) {
                x = 0.0
            }
        }
    }
}
``` 
 
## If-else statements         
 
<img alt="../media/conditionals-002.jpg" src="../media/conditionals-002.jpg" loading="lazy"> 
 
```kotlin
import org.openrndr.application
import org.openrndr.color.ColorRGBa

fun main() = application {
    configure {
        width = 720
        height = 720
    }
    program {
        var x = 0.0
        extend {
            if (x < 360.0) {
                drawer.clear(ColorRGBa.PINK)
            } else {
                drawer.clear(ColorRGBa.BLUE)
            }
            drawer.circle(x, 360.0, 20.0)
            x = x + 1.0 // re-assign x to the current value of x plus 1.0
            
            if (x > 720.0) {
                x = 0.0
            }
        }
    }
}
```
